intro: Onosma tricerosperma subsp. tricerosperma, commonly known as the three-seeded onosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. This subspecies is native to parts of the Middle East and Central Asia, where it thrives in dry, well-drained environments.
